gov.nih.nci.cabig.caaers.tools.hibernate
Class LocalSessionFactoryBeanWithOracle11Support

java.lang.Object
  org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.AbstractSessionFactoryBean
      org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.LocalSessionFactoryBean
          gov.nih.nci.cabig.caaers.tools.hibernate.LocalSessionFactoryBeanWithOracle11Support
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanClassLoaderAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean, org.springframework.beans.factory.FactoryBean, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.dao.support.PersistenceExceptionTranslator
public class LocalSessionFactoryBeanWithOracle11Support
extends org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.LocalSessionFactoryBean

This class was introduced in order to resolve the problem introduced by upgrading to Hibernate 3.2.7. If Oracle 11g is used, automated dialect detection will fail in Hibernate 3.2.7; Hibernate throws an exception for any Oracle version above 10. I could not find any easy way to set the hibernate.dialect on auditSessionFactory. Instead, this class will detect a situation when Oracle is used and dialect is not explicitly set, and in this case it will forcibly set the dialect to Oracle 9.

See http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/browse/HHH-3159 and http://www.google.com/codesearch/p?hl=en#2RoPTt8R44g/trunk/ hibernateAdapter /lib/hibernate-3.2.5ga/src/org/hibernate/dialect/DialectFactory .java&q=DialectFactory&sa=N&cd=2&ct=rc&t=1&l=130

Author:
dkrylov
